author: Rozina Sabur
title: Tamara Ecclestone faces barrage of online criticism as she posts pictures of her breastfeeding, reigniting debate around late weaning
text:
T amara Ecclestone has hit out at "bitter people" after facing a barrage of criticism for posting showing her breast feeding her daughter, reigniting debate around late weaning. 
The 32-year-old posted an elegant picture of her nursing her daughter Sophia on Instagram on Thursday, saying she wanted to normalise the practice.
Tamara Ecclestone has hit out at critics Credit: Tamara Ecclestone T he picture was from a shoot with photographer Ivette Ivens, in which the heiress railed against the "hatred" she was experiencing on social media and attacked the "sexualising" of breastfeeding. 
It showed her in a flowing white dress as Sophia, her daughter with former City trader Jay Rutland, clutched her mother's breast while peering at the camera .
In the Instagram post, Ms Ecclestone said: "Find it a very sad and surprising sign of the times and the world we live in that the act of breast feeding your child evokes such hatred in so many bitter people. 
"I am astonished that breast feeding mums get such a hard time as there is no reason why we should.
"I support and empower all mums and I personally believe hatred is so heavy and bad for the soul."
She continued: "I would never ask someone when they will take away their toddlers bottle or follow on formula or cows milk or dummy or comforter nor do I judge those who choose to formula feed their children of give them cows milk. 
Find it a very sad and surprising sign of the times and the world we live in that the act of breast feeding your child evokes such hatred in so many bitter people. I am astonished that breast feeding mums get such a hard time as there is no reason why we should. I would never ask someone when they will take away their toddlers bottle or follow on formula or cows milk or dummy or comforter nor do I judge those who choose to formula feed their children of give them cows milk. I support and empower all mums and I personally believe hatred is so heavy and bad for the soul. I hope by the time Fifi is a mumma people who have chosen to be open about Their breast feeding journey will mean that seeing a picture of a mum feeding their child won't evoke any reaction and that it is seen only for what it is a mum doing her best. To me there is nothing but love in this photograph and I find is such a shame that it brings out anger in some of you it's sad for you that that's how you choose to live particularly those that have made comments trying to sexualise breastfeeding are particularly unwell. I chose love. I want my daughter to grow up in a better world where this is nothing but normal in a better world. 
A photo posted by Tamara Ecclestone Rutland (@tamaraecclestoneofficial) on Feb 9, 2017 at 4:51am PST 
M s Ecclestone recently revealed that she plans to continue breastfeeding Sophia, until she's four years old, and has shared a number of images of herself breastfeeding her daughter in a defiance of her critics. 
✈️✌️ 
A photo posted by Tamara Ecclestone Rutland (@tamaraecclestoneofficial) on Jul 25, 2016 at 2:13am PDT 
T he move provoked a flurry of comments from her social media followers, with some praising her for speaking up, and others suggesting Sophia was too old to be nursed. 
Ms Ecclestone - the daughter of billionaire former Formula One owner Bernie Ecclestone - told her followers she was doing her "best" for her daughter, and couldn't understand why others were so "angry" about her parenting decision. 
Bernie Ecclestone with his two daughters Petra Ecclestone (l) and Tamara Ecclestone (r) Credit: Rex S he said: "I hope by the time Fifi [Sophia] is a mumma people who have chosen to be open about their breast feeding journey will mean that seeing a picture of a mum feeding their child won't evoke any reaction and that it is seen only for what it is - a mum doing her best. 
"To me there is nothing but love in this photograph and I find is such a shame that it brings out anger in some of you it's sad for you that that's how you choose to live particularly those that have made comments trying to sexualise breastfeeding are particularly unwell. 
"I chose love. I want my daughter to grow up in a better world where this is nothing but normal in a better world." 
Thank you @ivetteivens for capturing this beautiful moment this is by far my favourite photograph but mainly thank you for spreading this message. Breastfeeding is a powerful demonstration of love and nurturing yet it has become so normal to hide. I want to take that normal and toss it. 
A photo posted by Tamara Ecclestone Rutland (@tamaraecclestoneofficial) on Feb 8, 2017 at 9:54am PST 
H er heartfelt social media rant came in a second photo after she faced criticism for uploading an artistic shot of herself breastfeeding her daughter 'Fifi', who will turn three on March 17. 
Speaking to The Sun's Fabulous magazine back in October, the heiress said that she found the outcry over her breastfeeding "bizarre". 
She added: "Yes, Sophia is two-and-a-half and yes, a lot of people wouldn’t breastfeed now. But it’s so comforting for her and she loves it."
Tamara Ecclestone with daughter Sophia and husband Jay Rutland Credit: John Alex Maguire/REX S he joked that her little "beast" might never tire of breastfeeding and she would be left with "saggy" breasts.
Ms Ecclestone said she would consider what to do if Sophia still wishes to keep breastfeeding when she turns four.
Ms Ecclestone has also previously spoken of the need for mothers to stick together "instead of picking flaws".
The star has said she is planning to have a second baby at some point in the future, which she hopes will be a boy. 
She explained that she was still focusing on her young daughter, while her husband revealed he couldn't wait to expand their family.
